# OluFooter

A simple footer that accepts a string of text and list of links

# Example

Copyright ¬© 2021 Kevin Custer. All rights reserved.

RSS | Sitemap

# Usage

<template>
  <div>
    <OluFooter :links="links">
      Copyright ¬© {{ new Date().getFullYear() }} <a href="https://www.kevin-custer.com/" target="_blank" class="font-bold text-green-700 hover:text-green-800" rel="noopener">Kevin Custer</a>. All rights reserved.
    </OluFooter>
  </div>
</template>

<script>
  export default {
    data: () => ({
      links: [
        { 
          label: 'RSS',
          url: '/rss.xml'
        },
        {
          label: 'Sitemap',
          url: '/sitemap.xml'
        }
      ]
    }),
  }
</script>

# Source Code

<template>
  <div class="py-10 text-center bg-gray-50 border-t border-green-500 border-opacity-50">
    <p class="mb-2 text-gray-700">
      <slot></slot>
    </p>
    <p class="text-sm text-gray-600" v-if="links">
      <span v-for="(link, index) in links" :key="index">
        <a :href="link.url" class="text-green-600 hover:text-green-700" :aria-label="link.label">
          {{ link.label }}
        </a>
        <span v-if="index != links.length - 1"> | </span>
      </span>
    </p>
  </div>
</template>

<script>
  export default {
    name: 'OluFooter',
    props: {
      links: {
        required: false,
        type: Array
      }
    }
  }
</script>

# Slots

# default

The string of text to display in the footer

# Props

Prop Type Required Description
links Array False Array of objects with fields url and label
